titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Courtney Dean, April 2016; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-01-16T10:27-0800

physdesc.extent: (5 boxes, 3 shoeboxes, 3 record cartons, 1 oversize flat box, 1 map folder)

did.abstract: Razorcake is a Los Angeles-based punk rock fanzine established in 2001 and published by Sean Carswell and Todd Taylor. The collection includes zine issues, microcassettes of interviews, and punk memorabilia and ephemera.
did.physloc: Portions of the collection stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page. Oversize material (Box 13) held on-site.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Razorcake/Gorsky Press, Inc. Records (Collection 2284). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Gorsky Press is an independent book publisher based out of Los Angeles, California, founded in 1999. Razorcake is the magazine arm of Razorcake/Gorsky Press, Inc., launched in 2001 by former staff and writers for the defunct zine Flipside. It features interviews, columns, and reviews, mainly focused on DIY (do-it-yourself) punk rock music. Razorcake is the first and only official non-profit punk rock fanzine in America. It is published by Sean Carswell and Todd Taylor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection includes a near-complete run of Razorcake fanzine along with microcassettes containing interviews conducted with punk bands and artists. Also includes a small amount of punk memorabilia and ephemera which belonged to Todd Taylor.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection has been arranged in the following series:
Series 1: Audio Interviews, 2000-2010
Series 2: Razorcake Fanzine Issues, 2001-2016
Series 3: Memorabilia and Ephemera, 1989-2015

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 140 microcassettes containing interviews conducted with punk bands and artists for Razorcake. Also includes several interviews conducted by Todd Taylor for Thrasher Magazine.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Published issues of Razorcake fanzine from its inception up until March 2016 issue. Collection is missing no. 47.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 59 t-shirts with silk-screened logos of bands, record labels, record stores, and festivals, including Corrosion of Conformity, Thrasher, AwesomeFest, and Jay Reatard's early project, The Reatards. Also included are several Razorcake shirts, notably the shirt worn by Todd Taylor on the cover of his book Born to Rock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Black flight jacket with patches sewn on.

did.unittitle: Book Your Own Fucking Life: No. 7, 10
